body:
(this was based on some other error and fixed on slack)

For others, here is the documentation to start  from a specific snapshot:

https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/functionDetails.md

By default, the pre-trained ResNet network is not provided in the DeepLabCut toolbox (as it has around 100MB). However, if not previously downloaded from the TensorFlow model weights, it will be downloaded and stored in a subdirectory pre-trained under the subdirectory models in Pose_Estimation_Tensorflow. At user specified iterations during training checkpoints are stored in the subdirectory train under the respective iteration directory. If the user wishes to restart the training at a specific checkpoint they can specify the full path of the checkpoint to the variable init_weights in the pose_cfg.yaml file under the train subdirectory (see Box 2).

> (this was based on some other error and fixed on slack)
> 
> For others, here is the documentation to start from a specific snapshot:
> 
> https://github.com/AlexEMG/DeepLabCut/blob/master/docs/functionDetails.md
> 
> By default, the pre-trained ResNet network is not provided in the DeepLabCut toolbox (as it has around 100MB). However, if not previously downloaded from the TensorFlow model weights, it will be downloaded and stored in a subdirectory pre-trained under the subdirectory models in Pose_Estimation_Tensorflow. At user specified iterations during training checkpoints are stored in the subdirectory train under the respective iteration directory. If the user wishes to restart the training at a specific checkpoint they can specify the full path of the checkpoint to the variable init_weights in the pose_cfg.yaml file under the train subdirectory (see Box 2).

Sorry but I still don't get it. I already knew that I can manipulate init_weights to retrain as you can see in my question. As I understand, init_weights=  C:\Users\user\Desktop\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\dlc-models\iteration-0\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\train\snapshot-1000
should work, but it makes my kernel dead.
I also tried like
init_weights=  C:\Users\user\Desktop\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\dlc-models\iteration-0\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\train\snapshot-1000.index
init_weights=  C:\Users\user\Desktop\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\dlc-models\iteration-0\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\train\snapshot-1000.meta
init_weights=  C:\Users\user\Desktop\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\dlc-models\iteration-0\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\train
But It gives me other errors or kernel dead in last case. could you please let me know what do you mean by "full path of snapshot-1000"?

The yaml file wants colons: 

**init_weights:** C:\Users\user\Desktop\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\dlc-models\iteration-0\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\train\snapshot-1000

Perhaps also try 

**init_weights:** C:\\Users\user\\Desktop\\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\\dlc-models\\iteration-0\\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\\train\\snapshot-1000

(and post the whole output if it does not work please)

> The yaml file wants colons:
> 
> **init_weights:** C:\Users\user\Desktop\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\dlc-models\iteration-0\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\train\snapshot-1000
> 
> Perhaps also try
> 
> **init_weights:** C:\Users\user\Desktop\LinearChamber-KAIST-2018-11-19\dlc-models\iteration-0\LinearChamberNov19-trainset95shuffle1\train\snapshot-1000
> 
> (and post the whole output if it does not work please)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419045-78fa7580-f7c8-11e8-967b-744764c0aef9.png)

---If I don't have snapshot in train folder and only have snapshot in snapshot-1000 folder, kernel died.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419429-1609de00-f7ca-11e8-9c29-42daf54d5120.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419121-de4e6680-f7c8-11e8-9ea0-438c30841312.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419481-5b2e1000-f7ca-11e8-83c9-af75b7ae8bd6.png)


--it I do have snapshot in train folder, starts with snapshot-100(not retraining).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419404-0094b400-f7ca-11e8-9444-de599ff861e6.png)


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419260-65034380-f7c9-11e8-9315-86c016540cfe.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419284-7d735e00-f7c9-11e8-8fd3-c7c965f2c4b1.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49419299-8bc17a00-f7c9-11e8-96b2-563565075b04.png)

For index error, I guess you can ignore it because I intentionally fixed max_iter by fixing multi_step.
Thanks for helping me.

Good, so it works if you don't put the snapshots in a subfolder. Note that they are also not stored in a subfolder... (i.e. during standard training, so I don't know why you would do this).

________________________________

It seems it does not start with snapshot-1000. I mean it starts from the beginning and it doesn't retrain. I can't say it retrains from snapshot-1000 because also loss function doesn't seems to be started from 1000th iteration(If it does, it should start from loss 0.02~ at least. but the loss starts from over 0.05 and even sometimes 0.1). 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49420730-39378c00-f7d0-11e8-8493-94158ecdcb76.png)
(Please take a look at these the images.. It's hard to say it is retraining from snpashot-1000. It seems to train from the beginning)

The reason I made subfolder is because I got this message on and on 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16134605/49420288-0e4c3880-f7ce-11e8-84e2-e4653fdcc9c0.png)

It is 100% starting correctly. It saves at steps you specify, ie 100... it won’t add 1000+100, just like the pre-trained ResNet doesn’t say iteration 1M plus X...  It only crashes because you edited multi-step.

> It is 100% starting correctly. It saves at steps you specify, ie 100... it won’t add 1000+100, just like the pre-trained ResNet doesn’t say iteration 1M plus X... It only crashes because you edited multi-step.

Umm.. ok. Now I got it. Thank you so much.

Hey, @AlexEMG 
i am using googleColab GPU to run DLC. The former iterations i have is 45000 and i want to increase the iterations to 200000 and do the retrainning. i am not really understand this 
In my original pose_cfg.yaml file, the  original is 'init_weights: /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/models/pretrained/resnet_v1_50.ckpt', 
and i change it to 'init_weights: /content/drive/My Drive/shauyin/dlc-models/iteration-0/#203Nov28-trainset95shuffle1/train/snapshot-44500' , i don't know whether this change is correct? 
And if correct, another strange thing is , 
after i run 'deeplabcut.train_network(path_config_file, shuffle=1, displayiters=100,saveiters=500, maxiters=200000)' , 
then still it goes to 'Config:

Starting training....' 
it still go to '/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/deeplabcut/pose_estimation_tensorflow/models/pretrained/resnet_v1_50.ckpt' 
something wrong with my change in the pose_cfg.yaml file? 
Or the way of retrainning is not correct? 
Thank you for help. 
Best wishes. 
shauyin

Dear Shauyin,

When you start training the code prints the pose_cfg file‘s content. So you probably changed it in a different shuffle/project?

Alexander

If you changed the init_weights and when you start training the changed path is not printed, then you changed the path in the wrong file.

This is why I said that you need to make sure you change the pose_cfg.yaml file of the model that you are training.
